nodes.title: Creating Liquibase migration for summary_id column
Database migration, entity, models, DTOs, and repository updated for multiple summaries
Multiple tab summaries support - complete feature implementation
nodes.metadata_json:
{"branch":"main","prompt":"Implemented multiple tab summaries feature per prompts/026:

Database:
- Added summary_id column to tab_remarks table
- Unique constraint: (project_id, screen_id, tab_id, summary_id)
- Migration handles existing data with default summary_id

Models:
- Created SummaryConfig class with summaryId, label, rows (1-50), maxLength
- Extended ScreenTab with summaries field
- TabRemarks entity updated with summaryId field

DTOs:
- TabSummaryDTO - single summary with config and content
- TabSummariesResponse - collection of summaries for a tab

Repository:
- findByProjectAndScreenIdAndTabIdAndSummaryId() - specific summary
- findByProjectAndScreenIdAndTabIdOrderByCreatedAt() - all summaries
- deleteByProjectAndScreenIdAndTabIdAndSummaryId() - delete summary
- Deprecated legacy method for backwards compatibility

Service:
- getAllSummaries() - retrieves all configured summaries
- getSummary() - retrieves specific summary
- updateSummary() - validates and updates content
- deleteSummary() - removes summary data
- Validates against template configuration

Controller:
- TabSummariesController with 4 REST endpoints
- GET /summaries - all summaries
- GET /summaries/{summaryId} - specific summary
- PUT /summaries/{summaryId} - update summary
- DELETE /summaries/{summaryId} - delete summary
- Full OpenAPI documentation

Commits: 57302c8 (part 1), 533b5b2 (part 2)"}

nodes.title: Information requests specification - screen-scoped design
nodes.metadata_json:
{"branch":"main","prompt":"Extended prompts/024-information-requests-to-external-coworkers.md to make information requests screen-scoped:

Key Design Decisions:
- InformationRequest entity requires screenId attribute (VARCHAR 50, NOT NULL)
- Each request belongs to a specific screen within a project
- API endpoints scoped to /projects/{projectId}/screens/{screenId}/information-requests
- Added project-level endpoint for cross-screen listing

Database Design:
- screen_id column added to information_requests table
- Composite index on (project_id, screen_id) for efficient filtering
- Screen validation: must exist in project template

API Changes:
- All CRUD operations scoped by screen
- Bulk reminder endpoint per screen
- Cross-screen listing at project level with optional screenId filter

Validation:
- New InvalidScreenIdException for invalid screen references
- TemplateService integration to validate screenId exists

Benefits:
- Organizes document requests by screen context
- Aligns with existing screen-based project structure
- Better filtering and query performance
- Clear organizational hierarchy

Commit: 520e373"}

nodes.title: Row groups expansion - comprehensive specification
nodes.metadata_json:
{"branch":"main","prompt":"Created comprehensive specification for row groups expansion feature (prompts/027):

Original: 86 lines with basic example
Refined: 612 lines with complete implementation guide

Key Design Decisions:
- On-the-fly expansion (computed when fetching tab data, not stored)
- Data source: Project.workers relationship
- Preserve groupStart/groupEnd markers after expansion
- Support WORKERS, EXTERNAL_COWORKERS, custom lists
- Store cell data with expanded rowId (e.g., 'row-2-1', 'row-2-2')
- Empty source = skip entire group
- groupLabel only on first row per worker/coworker

Placeholder System:
- WORKERS: All User entity fields ({worker.id}, {worker.firstName}, etc.)
- EXTERNAL_COWORKERS: id, name, email, phone
- Allowed in: rowId, groupLabel, label, column labels/defaultValue/options
- Forbidden in: columnId, groupStart/groupEnd, column type
- Missing fields  empty string

Specification Includes:
- Overview and use cases
- Group sources documentation
- Template structure and syntax
- Placeholder resolution rules
- 5-step expansion algorithm
- Complete examples (workers + external coworkers)
- Data storage strategy
- API changes
- Implementation requirements (RowExpansionService, GroupSource enum, Row model)
- Validation rules
- Error handling (4 custom exceptions)
- Testing requirements
- Performance analysis (O(nm))
- Migration path (non-breaking)
- Future enhancements

User answered 12 clarifying questions to ensure spec accuracy.

Commit: 2e608f0"}

nodes.title: Row groups expansion - dynamic row generation
nodes.metadata_json:
{"branch":"main","prompt":"Implemented complete row groups expansion feature (prompts/027):

Components Created:
- GroupSource enum (WORKERS, EXTERNAL_COWORKERS)
- Row model updates (groupStart, groupEnd, groupSource fields)
- RowExpansionService (350+ lines, 10 methods)
- 4 custom exceptions for validation
- Integration with ProjectScreenService.getRows()

Key Features:
- On-the-fly expansion when fetching tab data
- Placeholder resolution using {worker.field} or {coworker.field}
- Validation: detects malformed groups, nested groups
- WORKERS source: ScreenUser entities  User fields
- EXTERNAL_COWORKERS source: ProjectExternalCoworker entities
- Empty source = skip entire group
- Each expanded row has unique rowId and can store cell data
- groupLabel only on first row per worker/coworker

Technical Highlights:
- Uses Jackson ObjectMapper for field access (avoids reflection restrictions)
- Deep row cloning with placeholder replacement
- Regex pattern matching for placeholders
- Comprehensive group structure validation
- Integrated into existing row fetching pipeline

Validation Rules:
- Every groupStart must have matching groupEnd
- No nested groups allowed
- groupSource required when groupStart present
- rowId in grouped rows should contain placeholder

Behavior:
- Template: 5 rows + 3 workers  Expanded: 13 rows
- Non-breaking: templates without groups work unchanged
- Performance: O(nm), negligible for typical use cases

User answered 12 clarifying questions during specification refinement.

Files: 8 files, 514 insertions
Commit: c4968b3"}

nodes.title: WORKERS source now uses ProjectWorker (project-level) instead of ScreenUser
nodes.metadata_json:
{"branch":"main","prompt":"Fixed WORKERS group source to use project-level workers:

Changed From:
- ScreenUserRepository.findByProjectIdAndScreenId(projectId, screenId)
- Screen-specific worker assignments
- Required screenId parameter

Changed To:
- ProjectWorkerRepository.findByProjectId(projectId)
- Project-level worker assignments
- No screenId parameter needed

Rationale:
- WORKERS should represent all project workers, not screen-specific
- Aligns with ProjectWorker entity design (project-level with roles)
- Consistent with EXTERNAL_COWORKERS (also project-level)
- Simpler API - no screenId needed for project-level data

Impact:
- Row groups expand for ALL project workers
- More intuitive behavior for most use cases
- Specification updated to reflect ProjectWorker source

Files Changed:
- RowExpansionService.java (repository, method signatures)
- ProjectScreenService.java (removed screenId argument)
- prompts/027-row-groups-expansion.md (updated documentation)

Commit: c627f68"}

nodes.node_type: Fix lazy loading in row expansion placeholder resolution
nodes.title: Replaced JSON serialization with explicit getter calls to prevent JPA lazy loading. Created getUserFieldValue() and getExternalCoworkerFieldValue() with switch statements for type-safe field access. This avoids N+1 query problems when resolving placeholders in expanded rows.

nodes.node_type: Add comprehensive unit tests for RowExpansionService
nodes.title: Created RowExpansionServiceTest with 13 test cases covering validation, expansion, placeholder resolution, and edge cases. Uses JUnit 5, Mockito, and AssertJ. nodes.title: Calculate totalRows from template metadata in progress calculation
nodes.description: Changed ProgressCalculationService.recalculateScreenProgress to calculate totalRows from template metadata (expanded rows + custom rows) instead of just counting RowStatus records. Uses ProjectScreenService.getScreenMetadata and RowExpansionService to get accurate row count including row groups. Handles missing templates gracefully. Implementation uses REQUIRES_NEW transaction propagation to avoid rollback issues.

nodes.title: Investigating row template expansion logic

Root cause: rowExistsInTab compares unexpanded template row IDs (lead-{worker.id}-q3) against expanded incoming row IDs (lead-4-q3), causing false negatives. Need to expand template rows before comparison.
Fixing rowExistsInTab to expand template rows before validation
Fixed row lookup to expand template rows before validation

Modified ProjectScreenService.rowExistsInTab() to call rowExpansionService.expandRows() before checking if a row ID exists. This ensures worker-templated row IDs like lead-{worker.id}-q3 are expanded to lead-4-q3 before comparison. All 138 integration tests passed.
Expand template rows in GET /projects/{id}/screens/{id}/tabs/{id}/rows endpoint

nodes.title: Investigating the issue in assignWorkers and updateScreenUsers

Issue identified: updateScreenUsers uses delete-and-recreate strategy (line 69) instead of differential update like assignWorkers. This loses timestamps, creates unnecessary DB churn, and risks data loss if save fails after delete.

nodes.title: Investigating check constraint and ActivityLog entity definition

Found mismatch: Java enums include TAB_SUMMARY entity type and SUMMARY_UPDATED/SUMMARY_DELETED actions, but database check constraints only allow ROW/SCREEN/SECTION/PROJECT entity types and don't include SUMMARY_UPDATED/SUMMARY_DELETED actions
Creating Liquibase migration to update activity_logs check constraints for TAB_SUMMARY entity type and SUMMARY actions

Created migration 2026-01-06-update-activity-logs-check-constraints.sql that drops and recreates two check constraints: ck_activity_logs_entity_type (added TAB_SUMMARY) and ck_activity_logs_action (added SUMMARY_UPDATED, SUMMARY_DELETED). nodes.metadata_json: {"branch":"main","confidence":90,"prompt":"User requested: check using integration test make ready-all tab rows does work even if rows are not filled"}

nodes.title: Examining existing ready-all integration tests to check if unfilled rows scenario is covered

Found ScreenAggregateControllerIntegrationTest with shouldReadyAll_markAllRowsAsReady test that creates UNTOUCHED RowStatus entries (no cell data) and marks them ready. Test passes, suggesting ready-all works without cell data. However, need to verify if this is the same as tab rows and if business logic should prevent this.

Found critical implementation detail: readyAll() calls materializeDefaults() before marking each row as ready (line 315). This automatically saves default cell values from template before marking ready, ensuring unfilled rows get populated with defaults.
Creating comprehensive integration test to verify ready-all materializes defaults for unfilled rows
Verified ready-all works with unfilled rows - test passes successfully

Confirmed behavior: ready-all operation DOES work for unfilled rows. Implementation automatically calls materializeDefaults() (RowStatusService.java:315) before marking each row ready, which saves any default cell values from template. Test shouldReadyAll_markAllRowsAsReady creates UNTOUCHED rows with no cell data and successfully marks them ready. All 7 ScreenAggregateControllerIntegrationTest tests pass.
Verify that approve-all operation has same behavior as ready-all for unfilled rows
nodes.metadata_json: {"branch":"main","confidence":90,"prompt":"User requested: Verify that this behaviour is the same for approve-all operation"}

nodes.title: Examining approve-all implementation to check if it materializes defaults like ready-all

Found key difference: approveAll() only fetches rows with ReadinessStatus.READY (line 199-201) and does NOT call materializeDefaults(). This means approve-all only operates on rows that are already marked ready, not on unfilled/unready rows.
Running approve-all integration test to verify it only approves READY rows and skips unready rows
Verified approve-all behavior differs from ready-all: approve-all only operates on READY rows and skips unready rows. Test confirms 3 ready rows approved, 2 unready rows skipped.

Key differences found: 1) ready-all works on any row (UNTOUCHED/UNREADY), materializes defaults, then marks READY. 2) approve-all only works on READY rows, skips unready rows, no materialization needed since rows should already be filled when marked ready. 3) Single-row approve() can approve any row regardless of readiness (different from bulk). Design: bulk operations enforce workflow (ready first, then approve), single-row operations are flexible.
Resolve error when project workers are changed after screen user assignments
nodes.metadata_json: {"branch":"main","confidence":90,"prompt":"User reported: When user changes project workers, if one was already assigned to questionnaire (screen), an error appears. Need to find solution - possibly auto-remove screen user assignments when project workers change."}

nodes.title: Investigating project workers and screen users concepts to understand the relationship

Found entities: ProjectWorker (project_id, user_id, role) assigns users to projects. ScreenUser (project_id, screen_id, user_id) assigns users to specific screens. Issue: When ProjectWorker is removed, ScreenUser references may become orphaned/invalid.

Found assignWorkers implementation: When workers are removed (lines 168-183, 218-227), ProjectWorker records are deleted. NO cascade logic exists to clean up ScreenUser assignments. This creates orphaned references.

Database schema: screen_user.user_id has FK to users(id) ON DELETE CASCADE. When ProjectWorker is deleted, User still exists, so ScreenUser is NOT cascade-deleted. This creates business logic issue: ScreenUser references valid User, but User is no longer a ProjectWorker for that project.
Checking ScreenUserService to understand how screen users are fetched and if there's validation against project workers
Implementing auto-remove screen user assignments when project workers are removed
Successfully implemented auto-remove logic for screen user assignments when project workers are removed
Writing integration test to verify screen user cleanup when project workers are removed
Integration test passes - screen user assignments are automatically removed when project workers are removed

Implementation complete: Added ScreenUserRepository injection to NewProjectService, created removeScreenUserAssignments() helper method, called before deleting ProjectWorker in two places (partner/manager removal lines 177, assistant removal line 225). Created integration test shouldRemoveScreenUserAssignments_whenProjectWorkerIsRemoved that verifies cleanup. All 139 integration tests pass.

Make KRS and REGON optional for manual customer creation (Issue #58)
nodes.metadata_json:
{"branch":"main","confidence":100,"prompt":"please implement

(Context: Issue #58 - Manual Customer Creation Without KRS)
Currently the customer creation endpoint requires all fields (name, regon, nip, krs).
This prevents adding customers not registered in KRS (sole proprietorships, civil partnerships).

Requirements:
- Make KRS and REGON optional (only name + NIP required)
- Database migration to remove NOT NULL constraints
- Update entity, DTO, and service to handle null values
- Add integration tests for new scenarios"}
